jobDescription: Company/Position OverviewThe Data Scientist/Architect will be expected to build statistical models, test hypotheses, interpret, summarize, visualize, and succinctly report on data holdings. The Data Scientist will analyze and model structured data using advanced statistical methods and implement algorithms and software needed to perform analyses. The Data Scientist may build risk scoring models, recommendation engines, spam classifiers, sentiment analyzers and classifiers for unstructured and semi-structured data and perform machine learning, natural language, and statistical analysis methods, such as classification, collaborative filtering, association rules, sentiment analysis, topic modeling, time-series analysis, regression, statistical inference, and validation methods. The position may require the Data Scientist to cluster large amounts of user generated content and process data in large-scale environments. The Data Scientist may be expected to apply their knowledge and programming skills working with technologies (such as Hadoop MapReduce or other big data frameworks, Java), and statistical modeling (like SAS or R). Prototype, evaluate, and implement solutions to complex problems. The Data Scientist may evaluate and implement massive, scalable data stores, and optimize support for ad-hoc analysis across various data sources.Mandatory Qualifications (Education, Certifications, Experience, Skills) 10+ years relevant experience to include:Experience using machine learning algorithmsExperience with model and algorithm development and optimizationExperience working with software engineers to implement and produce models and algorithmsUnderstanding of cybersecurity operations and best practicesTechnical expertise/capabilities to perform database management (including evaluation, system analysis, and the design of complex applications)Strong knowledge of software engineering best practices and computer science fundamentalsExperience analyzing customer needs, including participating in strategic planning, and ensuring solutions adopted are appropriate to meet objectives
